basics.name: Virginia Koday
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am graduating in May 2018 with a BA in Information and Computer Science with a certificate in Russian Studies at the University of Hawaii.

education.area: Information and Computer Science with a Certificate in Russian Studies (expected Spring, 2018)

education.institution: Vladivostok State University of Economics and Service

work.summary: Managed a team of Marines on a Deployment
highlights: Planned, directed, and coordinated the staff of a retrograde and demolition crew.
Successfully developed and maintained liaisons with other units and on-site companies so that there was good coordination of retrograde and demolition projects .

Managed the retrograde projects, which included the assignment of crew leaders, scheduling work times, managing personal equipment, ensuring that safety protocols were followed, creating appointments for heavy equipment use, and creating appointments at disposition sites.
Managed and supervised the retrograde over 10 million dollars’ worth of military equipment

work.position: Radio Shop Chief, Camp Pendleton, California
work.summary: Supervised the repair of electronic equipment
highlights: Supervised the activities of a 39 team radio technician crew.
Read reports, attended meetings, trained personnel, and ensured equipment accountability.
Provided guidance and instruction to Marines to achieve 100% efficiency within the shop.

work.position: Computer Shop Chief, Camp Lejeune, North Carolina
work.summary: Supervised the repair of electronic equipment
highlights: Supervised the activities of a 26 team computer technician crew.
Participated in board meetings with other supervisors.
Managed over $50,000 dollars’ worth of technical equipment.

work.position: Shipping and Receiving NCO, Camp Lejeune, North Carolina
highlights: Provided customer service to the platoon.
Monitored and recorded the input and output of all broken and repaired gear in the platoon
Maintained liaisons with other units outside of the battalion
Maintained a shop which received a grade of 100% upon inspection.

work.position: Computer Technician, Camp Lejeune, North Carolina
work.summary: Repaired and conducted maintenance of electronic equipment
highlights: Successfully repaired computer devices
Conducted inspections of devices and equipment to diagnose and troubleshoot
Inventoried and tested repair equipment to ensure accountability and calibration.
maintained a Secret clearance
Learned about various cultural practices of Russia
Assisted the promotion of the Russian Culture at various public events

volunteer.summary: Assisted in the Gen-Cyber summer program for high-schoolers
highlights: Designed cryptographic puzzle for students
Lead discussion on Python programming

awards.title: NATO ISAF Medal
awards.summary: The NATO ISAF medal was awarded for service with the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in relation to the International Security Asistance Force Operation in Afghanistan.
